definition.value: This is the net amount that the Part D plan paid for a PDE that was covered by the Medicare Part D benefit.

code.value: Gross Drug Cost Below Out-of-Pocket Threshold (GDCB)

definition.value: This variable is the portion of the gross drug cost for the prescription drug fill that was not covered by Part D’s catastrophic coverage.

code.value: Gross Drug Cost Above Out-of-Pocket Threshold (GDCA)

definition.value: This variable is the portion of the gross drug cost for the prescription drug fill that was covered by Part D’s catastrophic coverage.
This variable is the dollar amount that the beneficiary paid for the PDE without being reimbursed by a third party.
This is the amount of any payment made by other third-party payers that reduces the beneficiary’s liability for the PDE and counts towards Part D’s true out-of-pocket (TrOOP) requirement.

code.value: Part D Low Income Subsidy (LICS) Amount

definition.value: This is the amount of cost sharing for the drug that was paid by the Part D low-income subsidy (LICS).

code.value: Reduction in patient liability due to payments by other payers (PLRO) Amount

definition.value: This is the amount of any payment by other third-party payers that reduces the beneficiary’s liability for the PDE but does not count towards Part D’s true out-of-pocket (TrOOP) requirement.

This is the price paid for the drug at the point of sale (i.e., the pharmacy counter), and it does not include any rebates or discounts that the drug manufacturer provides directly to the Part D plan sponsor.
This variable indicates the amount of the discount provided by the drug’s manufacturer under the Medicare Coverage Gap Discount Program, as calculated by CMS based on data reported in the PDE.
